intro: Panicularia dives, commonly known as the blueweed, is an annual flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, producing a blue or purple coloration. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
